channel.title: Please help i need an ip
channel.description: well i have my server and everty thing but i have no fricken idea how to give it and ip or let others play?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!? please help if somebody helps me i will give them co on my server.

item.title: Please help i need an ip
item.dc:creator: @hippo429 hippo429
item.description:
@hippo429 wrote:

ok look. go to www.no-ip.com get an acount and create a host (the host is example.no-ip.biz) dowload NO-IP DUC. open up no-ip DUC login and check you host. now go in start menu all programs, acessories , and open up command prompt. put in ipconfig it will come up with three numbers. use the default gateway and put it in your browser. enter name and pass and the rest is explained there.

i am not explaining more than this there are like 3954858347 gigs of text about portforwarding in the tutorials section.

Read full topic
item.source: Please help i need an ip

item.title: Please help i need an ip

item.source: Please help i need an ip

item.title: Please help i need an ip
item.dc:creator: @The_Disciple The Disciple
item.description:
@The_Disciple wrote:

[quote=“Lorenzo Vq, post:2, topic:337606”]LOL! well, you didnt portforward im guessing. to do this, go to http://www.no-ip.com/ and set up a static IP address.

Next, open up an internet, and in the address bar type in 192.168.1.1, put in your username and pass.

next, Click Applications and gaming, and put in the required information.

And to get the last 3 digits of your ip, open up run program, and type in ipconfig.

HOPE THIS HELPED
remember to add your no-ip’s ip to the client files.
COMPILE ooooh and remember when portforwarding to select TCP! :D[/quote]Not everyone has the same router as you… I know for me, I would get completely lost.

Go to www.portforward.com for a guide on portforwarding.

Read full topic
item.source: Please help i need an ip

item.source: Please help i need an ip

item.title: Please help i need an ip
item.dc:creator: @Lorenzo_Vq Lorenzo Vq
item.description:
@Lorenzo_Vq wrote:

LOL! well, you didnt portforward im guessing. to do this, go to http://www.no-ip.com/ and set up a static IP address.

Next, open up an internet, and in the address bar type in 192.168.1.1, put in your username and pass.

next, Click Applications and gaming, and put in the required information.

And to get the last 3 digits of your ip, open up run program, and type in ipconfig.

HOPE THIS HELPED
remember to add your no-ip’s ip to the client files.
COMPILE ooooh and remember when portforwarding to select TCP!

Read full topic
item.source: Please help i need an ip
